result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

State's
Defn
and returned.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $2,000 (per case). $250 previously posted to apply. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
- Defendant must contact Dennis Franklin from EXPO 608-467-2495.
- Defendant must continue to take medications as prescribed." 
- Defendant must contact PACT and follow treatment recommendations.
- Defendant must reside w/ grandmother DR at 404 Algoma Dr Apt 27, Madison, WI 53704. 
- Defendant must be in residence every day from 8p-6a. 
- Defendant may only leave residence for treatment, to meet w/ Atty, to apply for jobs, employment, school/education, medical appointments, and attending court hearings
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Alec A, James A, Lucas C, or Kush D. 
- Defendant shall not be at The Hub Apartments on N Frances St in Madison.
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:38 AM Defendant David Clash-Miller in court, in custody.  Attorney Adam Matthias Welch in court for David Clash-Miller.  Attorney Hector Al-Homsi in court for State of Wisconsin. ADA believes the defn is competent. Atty Welch stipulates to competency. Court received the report. Court questioned defn. Defn believes he is competent. Court found defn competent to proceed. Prelim scheduled: 9/8/2022 at 8:30 a.m. Re: defn's bail mtn. Discussion re: resolving bail on all the cases together and on a new case that is coming. Agreement that defn counsel should reach out to Judge Taylor to have them all heard together.
